summary: An email from an FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager to FBI colleagues regarding missing contact information for victims to be invited to a survivor briefing. The email references a master list of invitees and highlights the need to obtain email addresses for victims or their attorneys.

persons.name: L. (DO) (FBI)
persons.context: Sender of the email, identified as a Program Manager in the FBI Victim Services Division, requesting assistance in obtaining missing victim contact information for a briefing.

events.title: Email regarding missing victim contact information
events.description: An FBI Program Manager sends an email to colleagues highlighting that the DOJ is missing email addresses for victims or their attorneys, preventing the sending of invitations for a survivor briefing.

keyFacts: The DOJ and FBI were organizing a survivor briefing for victims in the Epstein case as of October 2020.
A master list of invitees existed, but contact information (email addresses) for some victims or their attorneys was missing.
The FBI Victim Services Division was actively working to locate victims to ensure they received briefing invitations.
The document indicates ongoing victim outreach and notification efforts by federal authorities years after Epstein's arrest and death.
